intro: Sloanea mollis, commonly known as the silky sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in countries like Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glossy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Sloanea mollis is often found in humid, tropical forests and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
